channel.title: Manage Extensions on
channel.description: Recent content in Manage Extensions on

item.title: Configure Extensions
item.description:
This section explains how to configure extensions.

In addition to configuring extensions during installation, you can also modify the configuration of extensions on the extension details page.

Prerequisites

  • You should have the platform-admin role on KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to Users and Platform Roles.

  • You have successfully installed an extension.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user having the platform-admin role.

  2. Click Extensions Center.

  3. Click the name of the installed extension to enter the extension details page.

  4. Click below the extension icon and select Extension Config.

  5. After editing, click OK.

item.title: Configure Cluster Agent
item.description:
This section explains how to configure the cluster agent.

In addition to configuring the cluster agent during extension installation, you can also modify the configuration of the cluster agent on the extension details page.

Prerequisites

  • You should have the platform-admin role on KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to Users and Platform Roles.

  • You have successfully installed an extension configured with a cluster agent.

Configure Cluster Agent

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user having the platform-admin role.

  2. Click Extensions Center.

  3. Click the name of the installed extension to enter its details page.

  4. Click below the extension icon and select Cluster Agent Configs.

  5. Choose clusters and set configurations for them.

  6. Click OK.

item.title: Disable Extensions
item.description:
This section explains how to disable extensions.

Once an extension is installed, it is automatically enabled. You can disable extensions on the extension details page in the Extensions Center.

After disabling, you can re-enable the extension to continue using it in the cluster, workspace, or project.

Prerequisites

You should have the platform-admin role on KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to Users and Platform Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user having the platform-admin role.

  2. Click Extensions Center.

  3. Click the name of the installed extension to enter its details page.

  4. Click below the extension icon and select Disable.

  5. After disabling, click , then select Enable to continue using the extension.
